trg_text: Cabinet welcomes the adopted motion to amend the Constitution of the Republic of South Africa of 1996 so as to allow for the expropriation of land without compensatio Government has since 1994 worked hard to reverse the legacy of land dispossession under colonialism and aparthei Working within the law, government has done much to ensure the continued productivity of the land, while speeding up the process of redress for those affected by land dispossession The matter has been referred to the Constitutional Review Committee, which must report back to Parliament by 30 August 2018.

src_text: omile kudu go netefat a gore t welet o ka naga e t wet wa pele, mola ka go le lengwe o akgofi a tshepedi o ya peakanyoleswa ya naga go bao ba amilwego ke ditiro t a go amogwa nag Taba ye e lebi it we go Komiti ya Tekodi i oleswa ya Molaotheo, yeo e swanet ego go begela Palamente ka moragonyana pele ga la 30 Phato 2018 le dikel Dit hi inyo t eo di tlago fiwa Kopanokgothekgothe ya Maloko a Palamente di tla hwet a tshedimo o go t wa go molokoloko wa ditheelet o t a set haba t eo di tlago latelwa ke dikopano t a komit Kabinete e ipilet a go bakgathatema ka moka go tli a dit hi inyo t a bona ka nakong ya tshepedi o ye ya go reri ana le set haba, t eo di tlago tli a ditharollo t a go i a naga ya rena pel Bjalo ka mmu o wo o kgathalago le wo o theilwego go batho, go tla reri anwa le bakgathatema ka moka ka tshepedi ong y Kabinete e t wela pele go ipilet a go dit haba ka moka go tlogela go
trg_text: Cabinet reaffirms its commitment to a solid public-private partnership as we pursue our energy transition objectives of the future and a better life for al This is needed to bring much-needed policy and regulatory certainty, and maintain South Africa s position as an energy investment destination of choice Listeriosis Cabinet extends its heartfelt condolences to the friends and family of those who lost their lives after contracting Listeriosis, and wishes those who are recuperating a speedy recover More than 180 people died and 940 cases were reported in South Afric Cabinet is encouraged by the intensive efforts by the Department of Health, the National Institute for Communicable Diseases (NICD) and the World Health Organisation to stop the listeria bacteria from spreadin To further strengthen these efforts, the Minister of Health, Dr Aaron Motsoaledi, will meet with the South African Nursing Council on Thursday, 15 March 2013.

src_text: omana le mathata, go akaret a taba ya nag Afrika Borwa e dula e bulet e kgwebo, gomme dipeelet o ka go temo le ka go bolemi di a amogelw Ke kgahlegong ya Afrika Borwa go ba le balemi bao ba dirago kgwebo gomme tshepedi o ye e ka netefat a gore re ba le palo ye kgolo ya balemi bao ba dirago kgwebo bao ba atlegilego Prot eke ya Ekonomi ya Diphoofolo t a Le oka ya Double Drift ka Set habeng sa Nofingxana Kabinete e amogelwa go tsebagat wa semmu o ga Prot eke ya Ekonomi ya Diphoofolo t a Le oka ya Double Drift ka Set habeng sa Nofingxana, ka Le okeng la Diphoofolo la Double Drift ka Kapa Bohlabela ke Tona ya Merero ya Tikologo, Ngaka Edna Molew Se se akaredit e go fana ka mangwalo a t hupo ya beng go mokgatlo wa dithoto t a set haba wa Likhaya Lethu Communal Property Association (CPA) legatong la Tona ya Tlhabollo ya Dinagamagae le Peakanyoleswa ya Naga, Mohumagadi Maite Nkoana-Mashaban Set haba sa Double Drift se amogilwe ditokelo t a sona t a madulo le t a mafulo ke Molao wa Naga wa 1913.
trg_text: Cabinet further urges communities to desist from illegal land invasion We are a law-abiding and peace-loving country with adequate mechanisms of dealing with issues, including the land issu South Africa remains open for business, and investments in agriculture and farming are welcome It is in South Africa's interests to have commercial farmers and this process can ensure we have even greater numbers of successful commercial farmers Nofingxana community s Double Drift Wildlife Economy Project Cabinet welcomes the launch of the Nofingxana community s Double Drift Wildlife Economy Project, at Double Drift Nature Reserve in the Eastern Cape by the Minister of Environmental Affairs, Dr Edna Molew This included the handing over of the title deed to the Likhaya Lethu Communal Property Association (CPA) on behalf of the Minister of Rural Development and Land Reform, Ms Maite Nkoana-Mashaban The Double Drift community was dispossessed of the residential and grazing rights by the 1913 Land Ac In 1994, this community lodged a land claim that was settled in 2012, resulting in Likhaya Lethu CPA being establishe The Likhaya Lethu CPA consists of 1 500 Double Drift Community members and received R6 million from the Department of Environmental Affairs to develop a wildlife economic business venture in the farm Naudeshoek (1 400 hectares).

src_text: Ka 1994, set haba se se dirile kgopelo ya go bu et wa mabu gomme se se phethagadit we ka 2012, fao go feledit wego ka go hlongwa ga Likhaya Lethu CP Likhaya Lethu CPA e bopilwe ke maloko a set haba sa Double Drift a 1 500 gomme sona se amoget e R6 milione go t wa go Kgoro ya Merero ya Tikologo gore ba hlome kgwebo ya ekonomi ya diphoofolo t a le oka ka polaseng ya Naudeshoek (ya dihekthara t e 1 400).
trg_text: working experience, her Aslina Wines will in 2018 sell 12 000 bottles in the United States of America, Germany, Taiwan and Ghana Cabinet congratulates Caster Semenya on breaking the South African 1 000m record that stood for 35 years at the Athletix Grand Prix meeting held at Tuks in Pretori Our golden girl won the race in a time of 2:35:44, beating the old record set in 1983 by Ilze Wicksell by almost two second Cabinet also commends Semenya for fulfilling her long-held goal to get a university qualification when she completed her Diploma in Sports Science at the North-West University in Potchefstroom Cabinet expresses condolences to the friends and family of Honourable Member of Parliament, Ms Loliwe Fazeka, who was killed in a car crash in the Eastern Cape, last week Cabinet also sends condolences to the loved ones of South Africa s Ambassador to Sweden, Ms Faith Radebe, who passed on Tuesday, 13 March 2018.

src_text: ala morago maikemi et o a rena a ka moso a pheto o ya enet i le a bophelo bjo bokaone go bohl Se se a nyakega go tli a melawana ye e nyakegago kudu le bonnete bja taolo, le go t wet a pele maemo a Afrika Borwa bjalo ka lefelo la kgetho la dipeelet o mabapi le enet i Bolwet i bja Listeriosis Kabinete e lebi a mahloko a yona a magolo go bagwera le go ba malapa a bao ba lahleget wego ke maphelo a bona ka morago ga go fetelwa ke bolwet i bja Listeriosis, ebile e lakalet a bao ba folago gore ba fole ka pel Batho bao ba fetago ba 180 ba hlokofet e gomme ditiragalo t a bolwet i bjo t e 940 di begilwe ka Afrika Borw Kabinete e hlohlelet wa ke maitapi o ao a tsenelet ego ao a dirwago ke Kgoro ya Maphelo, Sehlongwa sa Boset haba sa Malwet i a go Fetela (NICD) le Mokgatlo wa Maphelo wa Lefase go thibela paketheria ya listeria gore e se phatlalal Go t wela pele go maatlafat a maitapi o a, Tona ya Maphelo, Ngaka Aaron Motsoaledi, o tla kopana le Lekgotla la Booki la Afrika Borwa ka Labone la 15 Hlakola 2013.
trg_text: Listeriosis is a serious and preventable illness that can be treated successfully with antibiotic Those most at risk are pregnant women, very young infants, elderly persons and people with a weakened immune syste People who show symptoms of fever, muscle aches, nausea or diarrhoea should visit their medical practitioner or local clinic immediatel Cabinet is optimistic that South Africa will defeat the current outbreak and urges all people to observe the five food safety rules during this time:Wash hands with soap and water before handling food, and after using a bathroom;Cook food thoroughly and do not eat half-cooked food as the Listeria bacteria will die when food is well cooked;Do not handle raw and cooked food together;Keep food at appropriate temperatures; andMake sure that all milk products are pasteurised or at least parboiled and wash non-cooked food with clean running water before ingestion or at least with pre-boiled wate Those with any uncertainty related to Listeriosis may contact the NICD on 011 386 640 Social grants Cabinet was briefed on the state of readiness by the South African Social Security Agency (SASSA) to provide the hybrid model in the distribution of social grants to beneficiaries on 1 April 2018.

src_text: oro bjo bo ka thibelwago bjo bo ka alaf ago ka katlego ka dianthipayothik Batho bao ba lego kotsing ye kgolo ya go fetelwa ke bolwet i bjo ke basadi ba baimana, maseana a mannyane kudu, bat ofadi le batho bao ma ole a bona a mmele a fokolag Batho bao ba nago le maswo a go fi a ga mmele, dihlabi t a me ifa, go sellega goba let hologo ba swanet e go etela ngaka ya bona goba kliniki ya kgauswi ka bjak Kabinete e holofela gore Afrika Borwa e tla fenya go phatlalala ga bolwet i bjo ebile e ipilet a go batho ka moka go latela melawana ye mehlano ya mabapi le polokego ya dijo mo nakong ye:Hlapa diatla ka sesepa le meetse pele ga ge o swara dijo, le ka morago ga go
trg_text: The process of changing the beneficiary cards will be done in a seamless manner that will not disrupt the payment of grant All beneficiaries who receive their grants through their respective paypoints which includes commercial banks, South Post Office and other retailer Cabinet calls on those who do not have bank accounts to visit their nearest SAPO branches to open their account Cabinet has instructed the SASSA, together with the Government Communication and Information System (GCIS), to do everything possible to inform all the beneficiaries of any possible changes that may take place in the process of transition from CPS to the new hybrid mode Cabinet remains committed to ensuring government adheres to the ConCourt judgemen SASSA offices will be open and ready to process the new application Cabinet urges all members of the public, especially beneficiaries and their families, to contact SASSA on 0800 60 10 11 or visit their nearest SASSA office for more information Voter registration Cabinet joins the Independent Electoral Commission (IEC) and President Cyril Ramaphosa in thanking all South Africans who heeded the call to register to vote or to update their address details in the past weekend s voter registration driv This is a milestone in preparation for the sixth national and provincial elections expected to take place in 2012.

src_text: omi a ntlwana ya boithomelo;Apea dijo di but we gomme o se ke wa ja dijo t eo di sego t a but wa ka ge paketheria ya Listeria e tla hwa ge dijo t e di apeilwego di but ut we;O se ke wa swara dijo t e tala le t e di apeilwego mmogo;Bea dijo ka dithempheret hara t a maleba; gomme oNetefat e gore dit welet wa t a maswi ka moka di a phaset heraeswa goba bonyane o bedi e le go hlatswa dijo t e di sego t a apeiwa ka meetse a thepe ao a hlwekilego pele o di ja goba bonyane ka meetse ao a bedi it wego pelen Bao ba se nago le bonnete bja ge eba ba na le bolwet i bja Listeriosis ba ka ikgokaganya le NICD mo go 011 386 640 Dit helete t a thu o ya leago Kabinete e sedimo it we ka ga seemo sa go itoki et a ga Setheo sa T hirelet o ya t a Leago sa Afrika Borwa (SASSA) go hlagi a mokgwa wa mekgwa ye ment i ka go abeng ga dit helete t a thu o ya leago go baholegi ka la 1 Moranang 2018.
trg_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Prevention and Combating of Hate Crimes and Hate Speech Bill of 2018 into ParliamenThe Bill aims to create the offences of hate crimes and hate speech, and to put in place measures to prevent and combat these offence It intends to address violence against persons on the basis of prejudic It will also give effect to South Africa s obligations in terms of international human rights instruments Cabinet approved for the iKamva National e-Skills Institute (iNeSI) Bill of 2018 to be submitted to Parliamen The Bill provides for the establishment of iNeSI as a legal entity with its own legislation to address e-skills (digital skills) capacity challenges in the countr Capacity development of e-skills is seen as one of the priority areas of government in building an inclusive economy, and to establish a capable and developmental statThe iNeSI will act as a national catalytic collaborator and change agent, for the development of digital skills and organisational capacity in the country Cabinet approved for the introduction of the Hydrographic Bill of 2018 into Parliamen The Bill seeks to recognise and grant legislative status to the Office of the Hydrographer, which has been in existence in the Department of Defence (South African Navy) since the inception of hydrographic services in South AfricIt will enable the Hydrographer of the South African Navy to be recognised as the National Hydrographe It will ensure that the provision of hydrographic services is formalised and enacted into la This is in line with the International Maritime Organisation and the International Convention for the Safety of Life at Sea, which is an international maritime treaty that sets minimum safety standards in the construction, equipment and operation of merchant ship Upcoming events1.

trg_text: roll and strengthens our democracy by ensuring free, fair and credible election Cabinet calls on all South Africans who were not able to visit their local voting station over the past weekend to visit their local IEC office to verify and update their addresse Alternatively, the IEC s online facility at wwelectionorza/MyIEC and the app remains available 24 hours a day for registered votes to check and update their address detail Well wishes for triathlete Mhlengi Gwala1 Cabinet joins the Minister of Sport and Recreation, Ms Thokozile Xasa, in denouncing the barbaric act of violence against a young triathlete, Mhlengi Gwala, who was attacked with a chainsaw while cycling in KwaZulu-NatalCabinet wishes the athlete a speedy recovery and extends a warm thank you to the medical team of St Augustine Hospital who are caring for hi Crime has no place in our society and Cabinet calls on communities to work together with law-enforcement agencies to bring the criminals to boo Drought declared a national disaster1 Under the leadership of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs Minister Zweli Mkhize, government has declared a national state of disaster to deal with the country s drought and water crisisCabinet extends its appreciation to those in South Africa who continue to save water and the relentless efforts made by the Inter-Ministerial Committee on Drought, together with stakeholders in all spheres of government and society, in dealing with the persistent drought conditions that have hit several parts of the countryApart from the fact that South Africa is a water-scarce country, Cabinet is assured that we remain a preferred choice of destination for tourist Cabinet decisions1.

src_text: Kabinete e dula e ikgafile go netefat a gore mmu o o obamela kahlolo ya Kgorotsheko ya Molaothe Dikantoro t a SASSA di tla bulwa le go itoki et a go
trg_text: Cabinet approved that the Agreement Amending Annex 1 (Cooperation on Investment) of the Southern African Development Community (SADC) Protocol on Finance and Investment (FIP) be tabled in Parliament for ratificatio The purpose of the FIP is to harmonise financial and investment policies of Member States, so that they are consistent with the objectives of the SAD This will ensure that any changes to financial and investment policies in one Member State does not necessitate undesirable adjustments in other Member State The amendments aim to preserve the right of governments to regulate in the public interest, and to balance the rights and obligations of investors and governments Cabinet approved the tabling of the Revised and Renamed United Nations (UN) Standard Minimum Rules for the Treatment of Prisoners ( Nelson Mandela Rules ), in Parliamen The renaming of the Standard Minimum Rules to

src_text: oma dikgopelo t e disw Kabinete e ipilet a go maloko a set haba ka moka, kudukudu baholegi le ba malapa a bona, go ikgokaganya le SASSA mo go 0800 60 10 11 goba ba etele kantoro ya kgauswi le bona ya SASSA go hwet a tshedimo o ka botlalo Ngwadi o ya bakgethi Kabinete e ba le Khomi ene ya Dikgetho ye e Ikemego (IEC) le Mopresidente Cyril Ramaphosa ge ba leboga maAfrika Borwa ka moka bao ba ilego ba obamela boipilet o bja gore ba ye go ingwadi et a go kgetha goba go mpshafat a dintlha t a diaterese t a bona mo bekeng ye e fetilego ya lesolo la ngwadi o ya bakgeth Se ke motheo wa go itoki et a dikgetho t a botshelela t a boset haba le t a diprofense t eo go emet wego gore di tla swarwa ka 2012.
trg_text: honours the legacy of our former President, who spent 27 years in priso There has also been a worldwide extension of the Nelson Mandela International Day scope, observed by UN Member States on 18 July, to promote humane conditions of imprisonment, raise awareness about prisoners being a part of society and value the work of prison staff as a social servic The rules will assist South Africa to speed up the transformation towards a people s developmental correctional system that is consistent with various international principles and guideline Bills1.

src_text: Palomoka ya badudi ba 2 767 139 ba etet e dite e t a go boutela mo bekeng ye e fetileg Go bakgethi bao ba ka fetago
trg_text: A total of 2 767 139 citizens visited voting stations over the past weeken Of the

src_text: milione bao ba etet ego dite e t a bona t a go boutela:Palo ye e fetago milione e ingwadi it e leswa ka seleteng sa bona sa bjale sa dikgetho;Ba go feta ba 800 000 ba feto it e boingwadi o bja bona go ya seleteng se seswa sa dikgetho;Palo ye e nyakilego go ba 500 000 e bile bakgethi bao ba ingwadi ago la mathomo;Go bao ba ingwadi et ago go kgetha la mathomo, 82% ba bile ba mengwaga ya ka fase ga ye 30 gomme palo ye e ka bago 54% e bile basadi;Gauteng e bile le palo ya godimo ya bao ba ingwadi ago la mathomo ka 2%, gwa latela KwaZulu-Natal ka 1% le Limpopo ka 1%.
trg_text: million plus voters who visited their voting stations:Just over million re-registered in their current voting district;More than 800 000 changed their registration to a new voting district;Almost 500 000 were voters registering for the first time;Of the new votes registrations, 82% were under the age of 30 and approximately 54% were women;Gauteng saw the most new registrations at 2%, followed by KwaZulu-Natal with 1% and Limpopo with 1%.

src_text: Kapa Bohlabela e bile le maemo a godimodimo a boingwadi o ka 87%, gwa latela Foreisetata ka 82%, gomme KwaZulu-Natal, Limpopo le Kapa Leboa t ona kat 79%.

src_text: IEC e begile gore lenaneo la bakgethi bjale le eme go bakgethi ba 26 250 939, gomme se se lekana le 75% ya set haba seo se nago le maswanedi a go kgetha, go lebelet we dikakanyo t a set haba seo se lego mengwageng ya go kgetha t a Tirelo ya Dipalopalo ya Afrika Borw Badudi bao ba ka bago ba 300 000 bao ba etet ego dite e t a go kgetha ba gareng ga bakgethi bao ba nyakilego go ba ba milione bao IEC e bego e se na le diaterese t a bona ge go lebilwe mafelelong a beke ao a fetileg Lenaneo la bakgethi leo le mpshafadit wego le leo le nepaget ego le tii et a seriti sa lenaneo la bakgethi ebile le maatlafat a temokrasi ya rena ka go netefat a gore go ba le dikgetho t e di lokologilego, t e di nago le bonnete le t eo di hlomphegileg Kabinete e ipilet a go maAfrika Borwa ka moka bao ba palet wego ke go etela dite e t a bona t a go kgetha mo mafelelong a beke ao a fetilego gore ba etele kantoro ya bona ya kgauswi ya IEC go tii et a le go mpshafat a diaterese t a bon Ka go le lengwe, ba ka tsena inthaneteng ya IEC go wwelectionorza/MyIEC gomme tiri o ye e dula e le gona diiri t e 24 ka let at i gore bakgethi bao ba ingwadi it ego ba lekole le go mpshafat a dintlha t a diaterese t a bon Re lakalet a moatlelete wa dipapadi t e tharo Mhlengi Gwala gore a fole1 Kabinete e ba le Tona ya Dipapadi le Boitapolo o, Mohumagadi Thokozile Xasa, ge a kgalema phatlalat a tiro ya botlaela ya dikgaruru kgahlanong le moatlelete wa rena wa mofsa, Mhlengi Gwala, yo a hlaset wego ka saga ya t haene ge a be a namet e paesekele ka KwaZulu-NatalKabinete e lakalet a moatlelete yo gore a fole ka pela ebile e lebi a ditebogo go sehlopha sa kalafo sa Sepetlele sa St Augustine seo se mo hlokomet egBosenyi ga go na fao re bo beilego gona ka set habeng sa rena gomme Kabinete e ipilet a go dit haba gore di

src_text: Dibeine t a gagwe t a Aslina di tla re ka 2018 t a reki a mapotlelo a 12 000 ka United States of America, Germany, Taiwan le Ghana Kabinete e lebogi a Caster Semenya ge a robile rekhoto ya Afrika Borwa ya Lebelo la dimetara t e 1 000 yeo e t erego mengwaga ye 35 e sa robiwe ka phadi anong ya Diatleletiki ya Grand Prix ye e bego e swerwe ka Tuks ka Pretori Mosetsana wa rena wa gauta o thopile lebelo le ka nako ya 2:35:44, a roba rekhoto ya kgale yeo e beilwego ka 1983 ke Ilze Wicksell ka metsotswana ye e nyakilego go ba mebed Kabinete e reta gape Semenya ge a phethagadit e toro ya gagwe ye e lego kgale a na le yona ya go hwet a mangwalo a dithuto t a yunibesithi ge a phetha Tiploma ya gagwe ya Dithutamahlale t a Dipapadi ka Yunibesithing ya Leboa-Bodikela ka Potchefstroom Kabinete e lebi a mahloko go bagwera le go ba lapa la Leloko la Palamente leo le Hlomphegago, Mohumagadi Loliwe Fazeka, yo a hlokofet ego ka kotsing ya sefatanaga ka Kapa Bohlabela, mo bekeng ye e fetilego Kabinete e lebi a gape mahloko go bao ba bego ba ratwa ke Motseta wa Afrika Borwa ka Sweden, Mohumagadi Faith Radebe, yo a hlokofet ego ka Labobedi la 13 Hlakola 2018.
